input: Bob is not furry. Bob is quiet. Charlie is furry. Charlie is kind. Dave is green. Dave is kind. Dave is round. Dave is white. Dave is young. Gary is furry. Gary is green. If something is white then it is not quiet. All young, green things are round. All green, white things are kind. If something is young and not furry then it is kind. All round, green things are kind. If Charlie is white then Charlie is green. Kind, green things are white. All furry things are young. If Dave is quiet and Dave is furry then Dave is not kind. Question: Gary is quiet.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : ¬ Furry Bob
axiom T2 : Quiet Bob
axiom T3 : Furry Charlie
axiom T4 : Kind Charlie
axiom T5 : Green Dave
axiom T6 : Kind Dave
axiom T7 : Round Dave
axiom T8 : White Dave
axiom T9 : Young Dave
axiom T10 : Furry Gary
axiom T11 : Green Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x → ¬ Quiet x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ Green x → Round x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Green x ∧ White x → Kind x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ ¬ Furry x → Kind x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Round x ∧ Green x → Kind x
axiom R6 : White Charlie → Green Charlie
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Green x → White x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Young x
axiom R9 : Quiet Dave ∧ Furry Dave → ¬ Kind Dave

theorem gary_is_quiet : Quiet Gary :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Gary is not quiet

theorem not_gary_is_quiet : ¬ Quiet Gary :=
begin
  apply R1,
  apply R7,
  split,
  apply R5,
  split,
  apply R2,
  split,
  apply R8,
  exact T10,
  exact T11,
  exact T11,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
